qas.question: When did evidence of wheeled vehicles appear throughout the world?
What form did wheels initially take?
The writing system of the Sumerian's is the second oldest to have what done to it?
What did the Sumerians map stars into?
How many planets were the Sumerians aware of?
What type of vehicle was invented in 400 BC?
What science was developed by Greeks?
How many planets did the Sumerians discover?

context: Evidence of <b5_0>wheeled vehicles<b5_0/> appeared in the <a0_0>mid 4th millennium BC<a0_0/>, near-simultaneously in Mesopotamia, the Northern Caucasus (Maykop culture) and Central Europe. The wheel initially took the form of the <a1_0>potter's wheel<a1_0/>. The new concept quickly led to wheeled vehicles and mill wheels. The Sumerians' <b6_0>cuneiform<b6_0/> writing system is the oldest (or second oldest after the Egyptian hieroglyphs) which has <a2_0>been deciphered<a2_0/> (the status of even older inscriptions such as the Jiahu symbols and Tartaria tablets is controversial). The Sumerians were among the first <b7_0>astronomers<b7_0/>, mapping the stars into <a3_0>sets of constellations<a3_0/>, many of which survived in the zodiac and were also recognized by the ancient Greeks. They were also aware of the <a4_0><b8_0>five<b8_0/><a4_0/> planets that are easily visible to the naked eye.
